meanings.definition: A kick delivered to a person who is lying on the ground.
meanings.sent1: He gave the bully a dropkick when he was on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler performed a perfect dropkick during the match.
meanings.sent3: The dropkick in the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her dropkick of sarcasm hit him hard.
meanings.sent5: The dropkick in the story was so powerful, it knocked the villain out.

meanings.definition: To kick a person who is lying on the ground.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to dropkick the attacker to protect herself.
meanings.sent2: The hero had to dropkick the villain to save the day.
meanings.sent3: He threatened to dropkick the remote control if it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: The soccer player dropkicked the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent5: I dropkick in self-defense when necessary.

meanings.definition: To dismiss or get rid of something abruptly.
meanings.sent1: The boss decided to dropkick the old project and start fresh.
meanings.sent2: She had to dropkick the negative thoughts from her mind.
meanings.sent3: He dropkicked the broken toy into the trash.
meanings.sent4: The company dropkicked the outdated technology for newer models.
meanings.sent5: I dropkick procrastination by setting deadlines.
